On Wednesday, October 1, 2003, at 3:21:08 PM, trz wrote:

> Ilja Preuss wrote:
>> Jim Dixon wrote:
>> 
>> 
>>>>The typical result is that latest jdk (1.4) are 30%-100% slower than
>>>>c/c++ code.
>>>
>>>100% slower?  You mean, I assume, that when you run C++ the
>>>Java is too embarassed to run at all?
>> 
>> Huh?
>> 
>> If the C++ program takes 10 seconds, how much is 100% of that? What
>> would it give you if the Java version where slower by that amount?

> I didn't expected this to be so strange. If c++ prog takes 100 seconds,
> 10% more is 110, 30% more is 130 and 100% more is simply 200.

Yes. I think one might usually say "twice as slow", or better yet, "took
twice as long".

Tonight it is going down to zero. Tomorrow it is going to be twice as cold.

Ron Jeffries
www.XProgramming.com
The fact that we know more today, and are more capable today,
is good news about today, not bad news about yesterday.
